title.et: Ettevõtte loomise, juhtimise ja arendamise seminar I

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
The Seminar of Entrepreneurship consists of three parts. A student in cooperation with a science laboratory elaborates and developes a science-intensive product. In seminars the participants of the course discuss their problems and activities and analyze their results.
In the first part of the course the student in collaboration with the laboratory finds a problem which can be solved with material development, and chooses respective product. He/she studies the solutions for similar problems and close products, and then makes plans for technology of fabrication, necessary equipment and source materials of the chosen product. He/she establishes a small business, or plays through establishment of the business.
description.et:
Ettevõtte loomise, juhtimise ja arendamise seminar koosneb kolmest osast. Üliõpilane arendab mingit teadusmahukat toodet koostöös mõne teaduslaboriga. Kursusel osalejate ühistes seminarides arutatakse tegevused igal etapil läbi ja analüüsitakse tulemusi.
Esimeses osas valitakse ja sõnastatakse probleemid, millele leiduksid materjaliteaduslikud lahendused uudsete toodete näol, uuritakse lähedasi lahendusi ja tooteid ning määratletakse toode, mille valmistamisele tulevane ettevõte keskendub. Kavandatakse või valitakse selle toote valmistamise tehnoloogia, seadmed ja lähtematerjalid, arvestades selle labori, milles üliõpilane töötab, võimalustega, antakse eelhinnang toote omahinnale,  tehakse turuanalüüs ning asutatakse väikeettevõte või  mängitakse läbi selle loomine.

objectives.en: The goal of the course is providing students with the knowledge, skills and experience for commercialization of applications of materials science, planning, establishment and running of a science-intensive small business.
objectives.et: Eesmärgiks on teadmiste, oskuste ja kogemuste andmine materjaliteaduse rakenduste kommertsiaaliseerimisel, teadusmahuka väikeettevõtte kavandamisel ja loomisel ning selle töö kujundamisel.

learning_outcomes.en: Upon completion of the first part of the Seminar of Entreprenuership, the student has found a laboratory which wants to cooperate in elaboration and development of a science-intensive product. The student has made a plan for fabrication of this product, and established a small business, or played through establishment of a small business.
learning_outcomes.et: Ettevõtte loomise, juhtimise ja arendamise seminari esimese osa läbinud üliõpilane on leidnud labori, millega koostöös materjaliarenduslikku toodet kujundada, ning teinud plaani selle toote valmistamiseks. Ta on loonud ettevõtte või läbi mänginud ettevõtte asutamise.

notes.et: e-learning is possible, registered students get information by e-mail

independent_work.et:
Business and technology project  will be prepared on iPlanner.net account:
Following Modules are fulfilled: BUSINESS MODEL; BUSINESS PLAN; FINANCIALS. 
BUSINESS MODEL includes: Value Proposition; Customer Segments; Channels; Customer Partnerships; Revenue Streams; Key Resources; Key Activities, Key Partnerships; Cost Structure.
BUSINESS PLAN Includes: The offer to target customers; The market potential; Reaching target customers; Provision of product and/or service; The team; 
FINANCIALS includes: Sales revenue and variable expenses; Other operating revenue; Operating expenses; Personnel expenses; Other operating expenses; Fixed assets. Financing: Share capital inflows and Loans. Financial projections: Income statements; Cash flow statements; Balance sheets; Performance measures.

Additional instructions and material will be uploaded into MOODLE account during the course.

description.et: The homework done as a group within the subject course is as follows: BUSINESS PROJECT consisting of a BUSINESS MODEL; BUSINESS PLAN; FINANCIALS. They are available in the www.iPlanner.net application environment on-line before the last seminar for presentations.
BUSINESS PROJECT Presentation done in the last seminar

grade_preconditions.et: The homework done as a group within the subject course is as follows: BUSINESS PROJECT consisting of a BUSINESS MODEL; BUSINESS PLAN; FINANCIALS. They are available in the www.iPlanner.net application environment on-line before the last seminar for presentations. Participated in at least 13 seminars

grade_evaluation.et:
The final grade consists of three parts:
Homework completed in iPlanner.net environment (teamwork, 50%)
Business project presentation (teamwork, 25%)
Business project writen report (teamwork, 25%)

debt_elimination.et: If the above mentioned requirements are not met, consult with the lecturer.

resources.mandatory_materials:
1. Wolfgang Runge. (2014) Technology Entrepreneurship. A Treatise on Entrepreneurs and Entrepreneurship for and in Technology Ventures. Karlsruhe Scientific Publishing. 1266 p. (selected chapters)
2. Thomas N. Duening, Robert A. Hisrich, Michael A. Lechter (2010). Technology Entrepreneurship: Creating, Capturing, and Protecting Value. Elsevier, 562 p. (selected chapters)
3. Passiante, G. and Romano, A. (2016). Creating Technology-Driven Entrepreneurship: Foundations, Processes and Environments. London: Palgrave Macmillan, 308 p. (selected chapters)
4. Fleisher, C.F., Bensoussan, B.E. (2015). Business and Competitive Analysis: Effective Application of New and Classic Methods. 2nd Revised edition. Pearson FT Press, 624 p. (selected chapters)
resources.recommended_materials:
1. Formica, p. 2003. "Industry and knowledge clusters: principles, practices, policy", Tartu ülikooli kirjastus.
2. Bygrave, W.D., Zacharakis, A. (ed-s). 2004. The portable MBA in Entrepreneurship, 3-rd ed., John Wiley & Sons, 494 p.
3. Hisrich, R.D., Peters, M.P., Shepherd, D.A. 2008. Entrepreneurship, 7-th ed., McGraw-Hill, 648 p.
4. Mets, T. (2017). Entrepreneurship in Estonia: combination of political and entrepreneurial agenda. In: Alexander Chepurenko and Arnis Sauka (eds). Diverging Paths: Entrepreneurship in CEE and CIS. Springer.
5. Mets, T. (2017). Is ICT the solution of the problem for Estonia? In: Harleen Kaur, Ewa Lechman and Adam Marszk (eds). Catalyzing Development through ICT Adoption: The Developing World Experience. Springer International (USA).
6. Mets, T. (2016). Is Estonia becoming better home for 'born globals'? In: David Smallbone, Markku Virtanen and Arnis Sauka (Eds.) Entrepreneurship, Innovation and Regional Development, Cheltenham: Edward Elgar, pp. 101-124.
7. Mets, T., M. Raudsaar, K. Summatavet (2013). Experimenting social constructivist approach in entrepreneurial process-based training: cases in social, creative and technology entrepreneurship - In: Martin Curley and Piero Formica (eds), The experimental nature of new venture creation, Springer, pp. 107-125.
8. Mets, T. 2012. Creative Business Model Innovation for Globalizing SMEs - In: Thierry Burger-Helmchen (ed), Entrepreneurship - Creativity and innovative Business Models, InTech, Rijeka, Croatia, pp. 169-190.
9. Formica, P., Mets, T. and Varblane, U. 2008. Knowledge transfer mechanisms in the European transition economies, in: Potter, J. (ed), Entrepreneurship and Higher Education, OECD, ISBN: 9789264044098, e-book ISBN: 9789264044104, pp. 289-311.
10. Mets, T., Kelli, A. 2013. The Impact of Intellectual Property Reward Regime on the Competitiveness of Innovative SMEs - Scientific Journal of RTU: Economics and Business, No. 24, pp. 99-104.
11. Kelli, A., Mets, T., Jonsson, L., Pisuke, H., Adamsoo, R. 2013. The changing approach in Academia-Industry collaboration: From profit orientation to innovation support - TRAMES. A Journal of the Humanities and Social Sciences, 17(67/62), 3, pp. 215-241.
12. Mets, T., Kaarna, K., Kelli, A. 2010. "Intellectual property - lever or barrier for the globalization of knowledge-intensive SMEs of small country origin" - Engineering Economics, 21(4), pp. 387-398.
13. Mets, T. 2010. Entrepreneurial Business Model for Classical Research University - Engineering Economics, Vol. 21, No. 1, pp. 80-89.
14. Mets, T., M. Leego, T. Talpsep, U. Varblane. 2007. The role of intellectual property protection in the business strategy of university spin-off biotech companies in small transition economy - Review of Central and East European Law, Vol. 32, No 1, pp. 19-40.

description.et: Introduction, What is entrepreneurship? How to think as an entrepreneur?  How to find business oportunities
Circular economics, product design Alar Saluste
Technology push and pull, introduction to business model
Financials inside business model, iPlanner introduction
Creating a team, critical skills, start finding your idea.
